qas.question: Who did Jesus say were his "brother, and sister, and mother?"

answers.text: Whoever does the will of God

qas.question: According to Jesus, who is "without honor except in his own town?"
What do some Biblical scholars claim that Jesus' family did with his message during his ministry?
Who had a conflict with Jesus and his family?
Who did Jesus send a message to while he was standing outside?
Who embraced his family according to the New Testament?
What was Mary reading when she was standing outside?

context: The hagiography of Mary and the Holy Family can be contrasted with other material in the Gospels. These references include an incident which can be interpreted as <b5_0>Jesus<b5_0/> rejecting his family in <b6_0>the New Testament<b6_0/>: "And <b4_0>his mother and his brothers<b4_0/> arrived, and standing outside, they sent in a message asking for him ... And looking at those who sat in a circle around him, Jesus said, 'These are my mother and my brothers. <a0_0>Whoever does the will of God<a0_0/> is my brother, and sister, and mother'."[3:31-35] Other verses suggest a conflict between Jesus and his family, including an attempt to have Jesus restrained because "he is out of his mind", and the famous quote: "<a1_0>A prophet<a1_0/> is not without honor except in his own town, among his relatives and in his own home." <b3_0>A leading Biblical scholar<b3_0/> commented: "there are clear signs not only that Jesus's family <a2_0>rejected<a2_0/> his message during his public ministry but that he in turn spurned them publicly".
